page.title: 18INDUSTRY AROUND STAINLAND
page.content: The pulp is flattened by large rollers before it is dried on heated rollers.Then it is cut into the required size and put onto cardboard tubes.It is then sent to the factory in Lancashire to be made into tubes. Paper making uses a lot of water,T.P.T.takes its water from Black Brook.They have a small dam in which they store water.They use so much water they have built their own water recycling plant.It removes the rubbish that is not needed in paper making such as polystyrene and polythene. {LOCAL CONTROVERSY In the past few months the Y.W.A. have been trying to get planning permission to use the old Coldacre Reservoir at {Marsden Gate}to compost sewage. After much local controversy the application has been turned down.
